title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 50.4 - Oath: apprentices and pilots
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 50.4 - Oath: apprentices and pilots

State Regulations

Before entering upon the duties of pilot service as such, each apprentice accepted by the commissioners, each pilot in training accepted
by the commissioners, and each pilot licensed by the commissioners, shall
subscribe to the following oath before a notary public: I do solemnly swear (or affirm) that I will uphold the

Constitution of the United States and the Constitution of the State of New

York, and that I will obey the laws of the United States and of the State of

New York and the lawful regulations of the Commissioners of Pilots, and that I
will perform my duties as (apprentice pilot) (pilot in training) (licensed
pilot) to the best of my ability. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. Tit. 21
ยง
50.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
